lines.line: Can I help you?
Do you have any quests for me?
There was recently some damage to the castle cellar. Part of the wall has collapsed.
The Duke insists that it was an earthquake, but I think some kind of monsters are to blame.
So what do you need me to do?
You should ask people around the town about it. Maybe someone saw something.
Sorry, I'm not interested.
What was I doing again?
I asked you to talk to people around Lumbridge to see if any of them know what happened in the cellar.
Greetings. Welcome to my castle.
What happened in the cellar?
The wall collapsed because of an earthquake. I'm waiting for a team of builders to come and repair it.
How is the adventuring going, my friend?
Oh no, it's terrible, isn't it? There was rock dust everywhere, it got on all my ingredients!
Hello. What are you doing here?
Do you know what happened in the castle cellar?
The wall collapsed. I had to spend all day clearing it up! The Duke says it was an earthquake.
Last night I was in the kitchen and I heard a noise from the cellar. I opened the trapdoor and saw a creature dart into a hole in the wall.
It looked a bit like a goblin, but it had big bulging eyes. It wasn't wearing armour, but it had this odd helmet with a light on it.
The tunnel was too dark for me to follow it, so I went to tell the Duke. But when we went down to the cellar the hole had been blocked up, and no one believes me.
I believe you.
Thank you, ! If you can convince the Duke I'm telling the truth then we can get to the bottom of this mystery.
I told you about the creature I saw. You should go and tell the Duke.
Bob says he saw something in the cellar. Like a goblin with big eyes.
A goblin? This validates my suspicion! We should tell the Duke!
Yes, he mentioned that to me. But I think he was imagining things. Goblins live in natural caves but everyone knows they don't have the wit to make their own tunnels.
Yes your grace, but if there is any possibility that this is a goblin incursion then we should take that possibility very seriously!
I think we should at least investigate.
Your grace, this is the adventurer who defeated the dragon Elvarg. I think you should listen to.
Your grace, this adventurer took that talisman you discovered to Sedridor. I think you should listen to.
Hmm, very well. I give you permission to investigate this mystery. If there is a blocked tunnel then perhaps you should try to un-block it.
You were helping to investigate what happened in the cellar. Come back when you've found something out.
The Duke asked you to investigate the damage in the cellar. I hope you can find the monsters that are behind this!
I dug through the rubble in the cellar and found a tunnel!
You see, your grace? It is a goblin attack!
That tunnel could have many origins. I suggest you investigate further.
See, it was goblins! You should tell the Duke.
On the ground I found this brooch.
I've never seen anything like that before. It doesn't come from Lumbridge. What do you think, Sigmund?
It is unknown to me, your grace. But the fact it is there is enough to prove Bob's story. It must have been dropped by a goblin as it fled.
I've never heard of a goblin wearing something so well-crafted.
Then it must have been stolen!
But it wasn't stolen from us. Where could it be from?
That doesn't matter! You said yourself that goblins couldn't have made that, so they must have stolen it from somewhere.
Horrible, thieving goblins have broken into our cellar! We must retaliate immediately!
First we should wipe out the goblins east of the river, then we can march on the goblin village to the north-west...
I will not commit troops until I have proof that goblins are behind this.
, please find out what you can about this brooch. The librarian in Varrock might be able to help identify the symbol.
Hello there,.
What can you tell me about this brooch?
I've never seen that symbol before. Where did you find it?
In a cave beneath Lumbridge.
Very odd. Have you any idea how it got there?
A goblin might have dropped it.
I've never heard of a goblin carrying a brooch like this. But just a minute...
The other day I filed a book about ancient goblin tribes. It's somewhere at the west end of the library, I think. Maybe that will be of some use.
'A History of the Goblin Race'. This must be it.
Hey... The symbol of the 'Dorgeshuun' tribe looks just like the symbol on the brooch I found.
I found out about the symbol. It was the symbol of one of the ancient goblin tribes!
You see, your grace? I told you goblins were behind this!
I still find it surprising that such a well-crafted brooch would have a goblin symbol on it. Perhaps you should find out more about this ancient tribe.
At last, proof that goblins are behind this! You should tell the Duke at once!
Have you ever heard of the Dorgeshuun?
Dorgeshuun? That old goblin legend. Lost tribe.
In time of much-war there many tribes. Big High War-God send Dorgesh tribe to fight beardy-short-people in mountains.
No no, he send them to fight tall people with biting blades, that what I hear.
It was beardy-short-people, that how legend go.
Make up your minds!
It was tall people! That what old storyteller say!
No, beardy-short-people. That how legend always go, stupid.
You stupid!
Do you want me to decide for you again?
That most stupid idea yet. If it happen it either happen one way or the other. You can't just decide which.
Yeah even goblins know that.
It doesn't really matter. What happened to them?
Well, they say, 'We not want to fight,' so god punish them.
That silly. No goblin ever say that.
What happen then?
They lose battle, that why god punish them.
Ha ha! If they lost battle they all be dead!
No no, they losing so they run away, and Big High War-God punish them for running away.
Who were they fighting again?
It was beardy-short-people in mountains.
No no, it was tall people.
What kind of god would punish them for refusing to fight?
Shh! Must not question Big High War-God!
No, because he much bigger than us.
Well either way they refused to fight.
Yeah I suppose so.
Anyway then Big High War-God punish them. He turn their insides to stone.
Ha ha ha! That silly!
Not as silly as green armour! What happen then?
He put them inside stone! Big hole open in ground and they all go into cave.
That not punishment! Caves nice and cool.
But then he close cave so they not get out! You not want to stay in cave all the time.
Why were there punished again?
It because they run away from fight.
No, it because they refuse to fight night before battle.
So do goblins make their own tunnels?
What? Make our own tunnels?
We hadn't thought of that.
Well I found a brooch underground, and I looked up the symbol and it was the symbol of the Dorgeshuun.
That not look like goblin brooch.
Goblins not wear jewellery.
Well if it Dorgeshuun tribe they not know who won big wars. You should greet them with goblin victory dance!
No no, you greet them with goblin tribal bow.
Doing bow make you look like a wimp.
It how tribes greet each other in old days.
Only if they wimpy tribes! Goblin salute strong!
So why is the Dorgeshuun tribe underground?
They punished by Big High War-God.
Wait, you say YOU won the big wars?
Well we must have done! We goblins! Goblins always win!
Actually we not know who won.
It was goblins I say!
Well why not show me both greetings?
That good idea. Watch.
Thanks.
Bye then.
Bye.
I spoke to the goblin generals in the goblin village. They told me about an ancient goblin tribe that went to live underground.
What more proof do we need? Nasty, smelly goblins have been living under our feet all this time! We must crush them at once!
Hmm, perhaps you are right. I will send word to the army to prepare for an underground assault.
, I would still like you to find out more about this tribe. It cannot hurt to know one's enemy.
I spoke to the goblin generals in the Goblin Village. They told me about an ancient goblin tribe that went to live underground.
I don't see how there can be any more doubt. You should tell the Duke at once!
Who...who are you? How did you get in here?
Help! A surface-dweller this deep in our mines? We will all be destroyed!
A human knows ancient greeting?
Perhaps you are friend after all!
Greetings, friend. I am sorry I panicked when I saw you.
Our legends tell of the surface as a place of horror and violence, where the gods forced us to fight in terrible battles.
When I saw a surface-dweller appear I was afraid it was a return to the old days!
Did you break in to the castle cellar?
It was an accident. We were following a seam of iron and suddenly we found ourselves in a room!
We blocked up our tunnel behind us and ran back here. Then we did what cave goblins always do when there is a problem: we hid and hoped it would go away.
We meant no harm! Please tell the ruler of the above- people that we want to make peace.
Eeek! The war-dance!
Hello, friend?
May I mine the rocks here?
No offence, but we will not let you mine here until there is peace between the humans and the Dorgeshuun.
Can you show me the way out of the mines?
Certainly. Please hurry, you must avert the war!
Is this your brooch?
We have more important things to think about than a brooch right now. We must prevent a war!
I've made contact with the cave goblins. They say they were following a seam and broke into the cellar by mistake.
And I suppose you believe them, goblin-lover?
Well, they seemed friendlier than most goblins, and nothing was taken from the cellar.
Actually, something was taken. Sigmund has informed me that some of the castle silverware is missing from the cellar.
Unless it is returned, I am afraid I will have no option but war.
We are preparing to go to war with the underground goblins over the missing silverware. If you think the cave goblins are innocent you should present evidence quickly!
Tell me about the silverware that was stolen.
The priceless Lumbridge Silverware! It comes out only on special occasions. It was kept in storage in the cellar, but now the goblins have stolen it.
So why did no one notice earlier?
That doesn't matter. You'll never find it, because the goblins took it. So you can't stop the war!
Some silverware has gone missing from the castle, and the Duke thinks you stole it!
Oh no! We would never do such a thing!
I assure you we took nothing from the cellar. You must convince the Duke we are innocent!
Where's the silverware you stole from the castle cellar?
What? We didn't take anything!
You expect me to believe that? Perhaps Sigmund was right: you're just thieving little goblins!
Why would we want to steal silver? As you see we have much silver already in our mines!
Well, the Duke says he will attack you unless the silverware is returned.
The last thing we want is war! If we had anything of yours, we would return it at once. But we don't!
Sigmund must be a member of the Humans Against Monsters cult!
You're a H.A.M member, aren't you?
What?
Well, so what if I am? It's not a crime.
Did you know Sigmund is a member of HAM?
Hmm, I had suspected it. But however much I disapprove of the HAM movement it's not actually illegal. I'll keep an eye on him though.
Actually I have found it! You put it in the H.A.M. cave!
I... I... You're lying! I don't know what you're talking about.
I found the missing silverware in the HAM cave!
Sigmund! Is this your doing?
Of...of course not! The goblins must have, um, dropped the silverware as they ran away.
Don't lie to me! I knew you were a HAM member but I didn't think you would stoop to this. You are dismissed from my service.
But don't you see it was for the best? For goblins to be living under our feet like this... ugh. It doesn't matter how civilized they are: all sub-human species must be wiped out!
That's enough! Get out of my castle now!
I see I was ill-advised. Unless there is an act of aggression by the cave goblins there is no need for war.
This peace treaty specifies the border between Lumbridge and the Cave Goblin realm. Please take it to the cave goblins and tell them I would like to meet with their leader to sign it.
You were taking the peace treaty to the cave goblins.
I, er, lost the treaty.
*sigh* All right, here's another copy.
I have a peace treaty from the Duke of Lumbridge.
A peace treaty? Then you will not invade?
No. As long as you stick to the terms of this treaty there will be no conflict. The Duke of Lumbridge wants to meet your ruler to sign it.
I will summon Ur-tag, our headman, at once.
Your grace, I present Ur-tag, headman of the Dorgeshuun.
Welcome, Ur-tag. I am sorry that your race came under suspicion.
I assure you that the warmongering element has been dealt with.
I apologize for the damage to your cellar. I will send workers to repair the hole.
No, let it stay. It can be a route of commerce between our lands.
, Lumbridge is in your debt. Please accept this ring as a token of my thanks.
It is enchanted to save you in your hour of need.
I too thank you. Accept the freedom of the Dorgeshuun mines.
These are strange times. I never dreamed that I would see the surface, still less that I would be on friendly terms with its people.
Prattle on, goblin.
Soon you will be destroyed!

characters.name: Bob
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, gruff and blunt tone, a small-town shopkeeper who speaks his mind without filter and has strong prejudices against outsiders.

characters.name: Cook
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, flustered and harried tone, a perpetually stressed chef who tends to dramatize situations and sounds mildly exasperated.

characters.name: Duke Horacio
characters.description: Mature male, refined British accent, dignified and measured tone, a nobleman who speaks with authority and careful deliberation befitting his station.

characters.name: General Bentnoze
characters.description: Adult male goblin, raspy guttural voice, argumentative and stubborn, speaks in broken grammar with theatrical indignation over trivial matters.

characters.name: General Wartface
characters.description: Adult male goblin, nasally guttural voice, petulant and quarrelsome, speaks in crude goblin dialect and constantly contradicts his counterpart.

characters.name: Hans
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, nervous and timid tone, a humble castle servant who speaks quickly and is easily startled.

characters.name: Mistag
characters.description: Adult male cave goblin, soft gravelly voice, cautious yet earnest tone, a hardworking mine foreman who speaks with quiet authority and measured concern.

characters.name: Reldo
characters.description: Middle-aged male, educated British accent, patient and scholarly tone, a palace librarian who speaks with intellectual curiosity and helpful warmth.

characters.name: Sigmund
characters.description: Middle-aged male, sharp British accent, cunning and duplicitous tone, an advisor who masks his fanatical hatred of non-humans beneath a veneer of concerned politeness.

characters.name: Ur-tag
characters.description: Elderly male cave goblin, deep gravelly voice, wise and diplomatic tone, an elder statesman who speaks with careful deliberation and protective caution toward his people.
